methods.canExecute:
Can this notification be executed? That is, are all of it's dependencies satisfied.

:param step: (long) - The step for which we are testing satisfaction
:return: (boolean) true if this notification can be executed, false if it has unmet dependencies
methods.waitForSatisfaction:
Wait for all of the specified dependencies to be satisfied on the specified step.

:param step: (long) - The step to wait for satisfaction on
:param dependencies: (io.deephaven.db.tables.live.NotificationQueue.Dependency...) - The dependencies to wait for
:return: (boolean) True if the dependencies became satisfied on the specified step, false if the cycle had already completed

text:
One-shot NotificationQueue.Notification that can be delivered when a set of
 dependencies are satisfied. This allows for an external observer to wait for
 multiple dependencies to be satisfied using waitForSatisfaction(long, NotificationQueue.Dependency...).
